title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.20 - Adoption of rules and regulations shall not constitute grant of rights
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.20 - Adoption of rules and regulations shall not constitute grant of rights

State Regulations

The adoption of these rules and regulations is not intended
to, and shall not be construed to grant any property right or expectation to
any person whomsoever. The NFTA expressly reserves the right to amend these
rules and regulations at any time and in any respect, as well as the right to
amend concession agreements and NFTA permits entered into pursuant to the terms
hereof by mutual concurrence of the NFTA and the holder of any such concession
agreement or permit. Additionally, the NFTA reserves the right to limit or
restrict access to any area of the airport, without the issuance of prior
notice, for reasons including, but not limited to, safety and security of the
general public, construction or renovation work at the airport, or acts of God. Any person who determines to invest time or financial resources in the
provision of commercial ground transportation service at the airport does so
with full knowledge of the foregoing provisions, and shall have no right or
standing to make any claim whatsoever against the NFTA by reason of any
subsequent amendment to these rules and regulations, any amendment to a
concession agreement or permit or any limitation or restriction of access to
the airport as aforesaid. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
